Where are postgres "types" stored by default?
In PostgreSQL, built-in types and user-defined types are stored in the system catalog table `pg_type`. You can query this table to see all available types:

```sql
SELECT typname, typtype, typcategory 
FROM pg_type;
```

The physical storage location depends on your PostgreSQL installation:
- On Linux/Unix systems: typically `/var/lib/postgresql/<version>/main/global/pg_type`
- On Windows: typically `C:\Program Files\PostgreSQL\<version>\data\global\pg_type`

To see your custom types for a specific database, you can also query:

```sql
SELECT n.nspname as schema,
       t.typname as type
FROM   pg_type t 
LEFT   JOIN pg_catalog.pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
WHERE  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');
```
